data.title: Dr. Charles Hutton Obituary - NYACK, New York
data.meta_description: One of the few remaining of the “Greatest Generation” was lost on Thursday, June 10 th  2021 as Dr. Charles Lee Hutton completed his earthly journey.  Born in 1925, Dr. Hutton lived his formative years during the height of The Great Depression in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania.  A lifelong learner, he earned his undergraduate at The University of Pittsburgh and his doctoral degree from The University of Illinois.  After his service in World War II and subsequent graduation from Pitt, Charles married the love of his life, Muriel Louise Thompson and moved to Illinois.   Dr & Mrs Hutton eventually moved to Atlanta, Ga, where he was Director of Audiology and Speech Pathology at the VA Medical Center in Decatur until his retirement.  Dr. and Mrs. Hutton were long-time members of Decatur Presbyterian Church, where they formed many strong and treasured friendships. They were supporters of the arts and enjoyed attending theatrical and musical performances until Muriel's passing in 1995.  He then married JoAnne Neill who predeceased him in 2018.  Dr. Hutton is survived by 3 children, 4 grandchildren, and 4 great-grandchildren. The family asks that donations be made either to the Muriel Louise Thompson (Hutton) Fund for Music, Theatre and the Arts c/o Decatur Presbyterian Church 205 Sycamore Street, Decatur Georgia 30030 or to United Hospice 11 Stokum Lane New City, NY 10956  A memorial service will be held for Dr. Hutton on Saturday, July 24th, 2021 at Decatur Presbyterian Church, Decatur, Ga. Burial will be private in Lost River, West Virginia.
